_comment: Created by rreed on 25/05/2017 13:34:16 using v2.7
title: What are the long-term trends in NHS staff numbers?
analysis_commentary:
As of February 2017, the total number of all full-time equivalent (FTE) NHS staff was over 1 million. Increases have been seen in the number of midwives (up 10% from 234,000 to 257,000 in 2016) and NHS Hospital & Community Health Service (HCHS) doctors (up 9% from 1.15 million in 2010 to 1.26 million in 2016). Between 2010 and 2014 the number of ambulance staff declined from 209,971 to 209,602, though this was followed by an increase to 225,600 as of 2016.

Updated April 2017.
